title: Anyone for dirty chicken?
content:
Hello

My name is Siaron Hughes, and I'm a graphic designer. I re-trained by studying  
a Graphics MA at London College of Communication 2006-2007, gaining a Distinction.  
I'm having a book published, and it will be in the shops in mid-Feb. The subject  
is on the rhetoric of fast food and dirty chicken shops.

Published by [www.markbattypublisher.com/](http://web.archive.org/web/20130821092332/http:/www.markbattypublisher.com/ "www.markbattypublisher.com/") in NYC.

I'd be really grateful for any feedback or advise on my book, please see some  
spreads below.

Many thanks  
Siaron

comments.content: no spreads...only a cover..which is cute. Could you post more pics please?

Hi, Siaron,

I read the info about your book on the **mbp** site... Sounds like an interesting project! Did it begin as a student thesis? I ask because some other recent design books had their genesis in student theses. Off the top of my head, I can think of [_Mexican Blackletter_](http://web.archive.org/web/20130821092332/http:/www.markbattypublisher.com/servlet/book_view?number=40), [_Parallel Strokes_](http://web.archive.org/web/20130821092332/http:/www.parallelstrokes.com/), [_Fraktur, Mon Amour_](http://web.archive.org/web/20130821092332/http:/www.fraktur-mon-amour.de/en/), and [_The Ten Commandments of Typography/Type Heresy_](http://web.archive.org/web/20130821092332/http:/www.amazon.com/Ten-Commandments-Typography-Type-Heresy/dp/1858943558/ref=sr_1_1?ie=UTF8&s=books&qid=1233809292&sr=1-1) (and I'm sure there are others).

See also the _Mexican Blackletter_ thread, here on Typophile:

[http://www.typophile.com/node/17496](http://web.archive.org/web/20130821092332/http:/www.typophile.com/node/17496 "http://www.typophile.com/node/17496")

I agree with Yehan's comment... Are you allowed to post some spreads? :-)
